title: I’m in the final third of my life
content:
According to statistics, I’m in the final third of my life. (I don’t expect to beat the odds, because I inherited a cancer-creating genetic disorder.)

This idea inspires the hell out of me. It eliminates procrastination. If there’s something I want to do, I have to do it now. Not much time left.

It helps me let go of what I don’t want badly enough. Can I die happy without it? Yeah. So nevermind.

It makes me write much more. Thoroughly sharing my thoughts online is life after death. My mind’s processes and decisions — my perspective and values — are most of who I am. The more thoroughly I share my personality while alive, the more it can be experienced after I’m gone. You can get into my head, long after my head is dead.
author: Derek Sivers
